From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To start interrupt mask profiling for all processes running on the system, use the **scheduler interrupt mask profile** command in global configuration mode. To stop interrupt mask profiling, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: The following example shows how to enable interrupt mask profiling:
ExtraInfo: This command enables the collection of details regarding the total amount of time a process has masked interrupts since the interrupt mask profiler was enabled.

RelatedCmds.description: Clears the interrupt masked details for all processes and stack traces that have been dumped into the interrupt mask buffer.
Configures the maximum number of entries that can exist in the interrupt mask buffer.
Configures the maximum allowed time that a process can run with interrupts masked.
Displays the information stored in the interrupt mask buffer.
Displays interrupt masked details for the specified process or all processes in the system.
